abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Caatinga Conservation
            and Management - Mata Branca (GEF) Project for Brazil were
            as follows: outcomes were moderately satisfactory, risk to
            global environment outcome was substantial, Bank performance
            was moderately unsatisfactory, and Borrower performance was
            moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            despite available time and resources, lack of quality at
            entry and suboptimal initial supervision were directly to
            blame for many of the subsequent problems during
            implementation. Many of the problems that affected project
            performance were related to the states' political and
            sociocultural context. Despite its shortcomings, the project
            demonstrated that sub-grants channeled through properly
            supervised subprojects and implemented by local stakeholders
            are a highly effective means of achieving project outputs.
